post.description:
A proxy endpoint for deleting an Adyen stored payment method, proxied through to [POST /Recurring/v49/disable](https://docs.adyen.com/api-explorer/#/Recurring/v49/post/disable).

For more information about how to use the endpoint see the Adyen docs:  
- [Adyen Tokenization](https://docs.adyen.com/online-payments/tokenization/managing-tokens)  
- [POST /Recurring/v49/disable](https://docs.adyen.com/api-explorer/#/Recurring/v49/post/disable)

id.description: Adyen stored payment method id / recurringDetailReference

200.description: Adyen delete payment method response. Responds with payload provided by the adyen API.

get.description:
A proxy endpoint for indexing available Adyen payment methods. This endpoint should be used for rendering the Adyen [pre-built UI option: Drop-in](https://docs.adyen.com/online-payments/drop-in-web) component.

For more information about how to use the endpoint see the Adyen docs:  
- [Drop-in UI docs](https://docs.adyen.com/online-payments/drop-in-web/tutorial-node-js#build-the-client)
- [POST /paymentMethods endpoint](https://docs.adyen.com/api-explorer/#/CheckoutService/v67/post/paymentMethods)

200.description: List of all the available payment methods Timezynk accepts.

get.description:
Endpoint for handling an Adyen shopper redirects. Sends payment details during a page redirect and determines the outcome for the shopper. Used for all payment methods that require a redirect

For more information about how to use the endpoint see the Adyen docs:  
- [Drop-in UI docs](https://docs.adyen.com/online-payments/drop-in-web/tutorial-node-js#build-the-client)
- [POST /payment/defails endpoint](https://docs.adyen.com/api-explorer/#/CheckoutService/v67/post/payments/details)

post.description:
Endpoint for handling an Adyen shopper redirects. Sends payment details during a page redirect and determines the outcome for the shopper. Used for all payment methods that require a redirect

For more information about how to use the endpoint see the Adyen docs:  
- [Drop-in UI docs](https://docs.adyen.com/online-payments/drop-in-web/tutorial-node-js#build-the-client)
- [POST /payment/defails endpoint](https://docs.adyen.com/api-explorer/#/CheckoutService/v67/post/payments/details)

A proxy endpoint for initiating an Adyen payment, proxied through to [POST /initiatePayment endpoint](https://docs.adyen.com/api-explorer/#/CheckoutService/67/post/payments). The endpoint should be used to initiate a payment via the Adyen [pre-built UI option: Drop-in](https://docs.adyen.com/online-payments/drop-in-web) component.

For more information about how to use the endpoint see the Adyen docs:  
- [Drop-in UI docs](https://docs.adyen.com/online-payments/drop-in-web/tutorial-node-js#build-the-client)  
- [POST /initiatePayment endpoint](https://docs.adyen.com/api-explorer/#/CheckoutService/67/post/payments)

A proxy endpoint for submitting additional details, if requested by payment provider.

For more information about how to use the endpoint see the Adyen docs:  
- [Drop-in UI docs](https://docs.adyen.com/online-payments/drop-in-web/tutorial-node-js#additional-details)
- [POST /payment/defails endpoint](https://docs.adyen.com/api-explorer/#/CheckoutService/v67/post/payments/details)

This endpoint will create a transaction and request a payment through Adyen.

This endpoint is using the Adyen tokenization flow. For more information:
- [Adyen Tokenization](https://docs.adyen.com/online-payments/tokenization/create-and-use-tokens)

get.description: Endpoint for fetching data from multiple collections related to an order. Will fetch data related to the order-id.

parameters.name: timereports
parameters.description: Specifies if data in the timereports collection should be included in the response. Will fetch timereports in the specified interval and include orphaned timereports.

parameters.name: approvals
parameters.description: Specifies if data in the approvals collection should be included in the response. Will fetch approvals related to the fetched timereports. Requires the timereport parameter to be set to true.

get.description:
Endpoint for fetching data from multiple collections related to shifts. Will fetch data in the specified interval along with orphaned* items.

\* *An item not in the current interval, but related to a shift, timereport, or inquiry.*

parameters.name: inquiries
parameters.description: Specifies if data in the inquiries collection should be included in the response. Will fetch inquiries in the specified interval and include orphaned inquiries.

parameters.name: timereports
parameters.description: Specifies if data in the timereports collection should be included in the response. Will fetch timereports in the specified interval and include orphaned timereports.

parameters.name: approvals
parameters.description: Specifies if data in the approvals collection should be included in the response. Will fetch approvals related to the fetched timereports. Requires the timereport parameter to be set to true.

parameters.name: availabilities
parameters.description: Specifies if data in the availabilities collection should be included in the response. Will fetch availabilities in the specified interval.

parameters.name: approval-requests
parameters.description: Specifies if data in the approval requests collection should be included in the response. Will fetch approval requests in the specified interval.

parameters.name: orders
parameters.description: Specifies if data in the orders collection should be included in the response. Will fetch orders related to shifts in the specified interval.

Endpoint returns an array of all quote shifts responses.

200.description: An array of quote shift responses

get.description: Endpoint for fetching a single quote shifts response.

post.description:
Endpoint for a supplier to confirm a quote shift response.

Side effects:
* Incoming rfq set to CONFIRMED iff ACCEPTED linked quote shift responses = 0.
* Linked quote shifts in rfq shift accepted list moved to confirmed list.
* (When an rfq shift duplicity = confirmed quote shifts, set other quote shifts to REJECTED.)
* Set linked quote shifts to CONFIRMED.

409.description: Quote shift response does not have status ACCEPTED

post.description:
Endpoint for a supplier to refuse a quote shift response.

Side effects:
* Collect all quote shift responses for incoming rfq.
  * When responses with status ACCEPTED = 0:
    * if responses with status CONFIRMED = 0: set incoming rfq to REFUSED.
    * else: set status to CONFIRMED.
* Linked quote shifts are removed from rfq shift accepted lists.
* Set linked quote shifts to REFUSED.

409.description: Quote shift response does not have status ACCEPTED

put.description:
Send updates to an outgoing RfQ that has not been SENT. Only updates to "expires" are allowed otherwise.

Side effects:
* If "expires" is updated, linked incoming RfQ's will also have "expires" updated.

400.description: This property cannot be changed after outgoing RfQ has been sent.

delete.description: Endpoint for deleting an archived RfQ.

get.description: Endpoint returns an array of all quote shift responses.

200.description: An array of quote shift responses

post.description:
Endpoint for a client to respond to a set of quote shifts.

Side effects:
* When ACCEPTED, linked quote shifts will be added to the list of accepted quote shifts for respective rfq shifts.
* Linked quote shifts statuses are updated with the same status.
* When ACCEPTED, incoming rfq gets same status.

requestBody.description: RfQ parent object to be created.

supplier-id.description: Id of the company owning the quote shifts.

outgoing-rfq-id.description: Id of the rfq parent this rfq was created from.

400.description:
* Outgoing rfq id not valid
* Status not "ACCEPTED" or "REJECTED"
* Quote shift or rfq shift not found
* Accepted and confirmed quote shifts are more than rfq shift duplicity

currency.description: Currency code. Only used to record the customer's selected currency when adding subscription payment method.

paymentMethod.description: Selected payment method from  /payment/v1/methods response. Full schema definition at [Adyen docs](https://docs.adyen.com/api-explorer/#/CheckoutService/v67/post/payments__reqParam_paymentMethod).

shopperEmail.description: Email of the shopper. More info at [Adyen docs](https://docs.adyen.com/api-explorer/#/CheckoutService/v68/post/payments__reqParam_shopperEmail).

email.description: Email address to where the approval request should be sent.

expires.description: Epoch timestamp of when the request will expire.

response-at.description: Epoch timestamp of when the response was recorded.

start.description: Start of the approval request without time zone (i.e. 2019-04-30T15:41:00.000)

end.description: End of the approval request without time zone (i.e. 2019-04-30T15:41:00.000)

html.description: Html content of the approval request.

reports.description: Array of the time reports included in the approval request.

formula.description:
Formula for more complex calculations.
Operator is applied between each operand. For example
```json
{ operands: [{ value: 1 }, { value: 2 }, { value:3 }], operator: "+" }
```
means `1 + 2 + 3`

field-id.description: Field ID reference where value should be fetched. Used as default value if formula is null or returns null.

value.description: Fixed value. Default value if formula value and field-id referenced value are both null.

start.description: Start of shift without time zone (i.e. 2019-04-30T15:41:00.000)

end.description: End of shift without time zone (i.e. 2019-04-30T15:41:00.000)

available.description: Does this mark the user as available or not available.

read-only.description: True if this availability is created via an integration and should not be changed.

meta.description: Field that an integration might use to store meta-data about the availability

price-settings.description: Settings for calculation and interpretation of price

unit.description: Article unit. Hours, pieces, kilometers, etc.

factor.description: Factor to multiply the article with after its nominal value has been calculated

calculation.description:
Controls how the article value is calculated by the agreement engine.
 * `null` or `undefined` - Use reported hours
 * `shifts` - Count the number of shifts that generated the article and divide the value over all applicable users
 * `shifts_no_users` - Count the number of shifts that generated the article and give each user the full count
 * `dates` - Count the number of distinct dates spanned by the reports
 * `days` - Find the minumum number of 24-hours periods required to fill the reported time spanned
 * `field` - Fetch the value from a numeric field

calculation-settings.description: Settings for calculation and interpretation of article count

archived.description: Timestamp in milliseconds for when the object was archived, or null if it is still active

form-id.description: Id of the order form used to create the order.

form-vid.description: Vid of the order form used to create the order.

original-duplicity.description: Original (when created) amount of people to be booked for the this order.

values.description:
Key-value store for custom fields defined in the order form associated with the order.
The key should be set to the `field-template-id`. See `fields` property in Order Form.

shift-dates.description: All dates which where shifts are occuring during the order

start.description: Start of shift without time zone (i.e. 2019-04-30T15:41:00.000)

end.description: End of shift without time zone (i.e. 2019-04-30T15:41:00.000)

group-id.description: Common group ID for grouping several shifts together

vid.description: Unique identifier representing a specific version of an item

company-id.description: Id of the company who owns this item.

created.description: Timestamp in milliseconds for when the object was created

created-by.description: User ID the the user that created the object.

valid-from.description: Timestamp in milliseconds for when the object was last changed

changed-by.description: User ID the the user that last changed the object.

archived.description: Timestamp in milliseconds for when the object was archived, or null if it is still active

end-date.description: Last date of blocked interval, if omitted then set to 90 days.

created.description: Timestamp when this block was created.

start.description: Start of shift without time zone (i.e. 2019-04-30T15:41:00.000)

end.description: End of shift without time zone (i.e. 2019-04-30T15:41:00.000)

criteria.description: Define how to match the interval

companies.description: A read only list of companies that have used the discount code

date.description: Date when the discount code was used

calculation.description: How to calculate discount based on discount field value.

width.description: Column width in 1/256 of digit 0, maximum 65280

height.description: Row height in 1/20 of a point, or -1 for default height

first-row.description: Index of first row, zero based

last-row.description: Index of last row, zero based

first-col.description: Index of first col, zero based

last-col.description: Index of last col, zero based

weight.description: Sort order for this field. Lower weight floats on top, higher weight sinks.

conditionally-visible.description: If set to true, the field should only be visible under a certain set of conditions. Visibility settings are found in `settings.visibility-options`

public.description: Allow everyone to see this field value and also show it in deeply linked presentations.

protected.description: Field should only the editable by and visible for managers.

override.description: This field definition overrides a field with this ID.

default-val.description: Default value for this field, if unset in the instance

registry-id.description: ID of referenced registry, in case field-type === "registry-reference"

visibility-options.description: Visibility settings, if conditionally-visible is true

fields.description: Array of fields requiried for visibility

FieldType.description: FieldType describes the different interpretations a custom field can have.

max-length.description: Maximum length of value stored in this field

response-ts.description: Epoch timestamp indicating when response was provided for the inquiry

open-shift-response.description: True if the inquiry was created through an open shift response

seen.description: Epoch timestamp that indicdates when the inquiried user first saw the inquiry

start.description: Start of inquiry without time zone (i.e. 2019-04-30T15:41:00.000)

end.description: End of inquiry without time zone (i.e. 2019-04-30T15:41:00.000)

values.description: Values for custom registry fields (from shift)

created.description: True if the inquiry was created through an open shift response

blocked-by.description: Id of the user who blocked the inquiry

reason.description: Reason describing why the inquiry got blocked

image.description: Link to the integration partner logo

company-id.description: Id of the company who owns this item.

invoice-date.description: The invoice date (date invoice was created, sent or booked).

due-date.description: Date when invoice is due for payment.

invoice-text.description: Longer multi-line message to the invoice receiver.

invoice-no.description:
Invoice number or code. Upon successful transfer Timezynk sets the invoice-no
to the invoice number provided by third-party service.

read-only.description:
When read-only is set to true, the invoice can no longer be edited. Only
cancel and delete action can be performed. Timezynk sets read-only as true
upon successful transfer to third-party service.

canceled.description: True if the invoice is canceled.

export-data.description: Structed invoice head data. Exact content dependent on target invoicing software.

generic.description: invoice head data applicable to most target systems.

discount.description: Discount in fractions to apply  (0.1 means 10% discount)

house-work.description: Set to true if article is tax-deductible as house work

target-invoice-id.description: Invoice ID assigned by target system.

weight.description: Lighter rows float to the top of the invoice, heavier rows sink.

currency.description: Currency in ISO 4217 format, must match invoice head.

house-work.description: True if the invoice row concerns tax deductible house work.

duration.description: Duration in hours of underlying time report. Used for statistics only.

report-ids.description: IDs of underlying time reports that generated this row.

export-data.description:
Structed invoice row data. Exact content dependent on target invoicing
software.

generic.description: invoice row data applicable to most target systems.

cost-center.description: Cost center for book-keeping this row.

project-code.description: Project code for book-keeping this row.

target.description: Target object this journal entry is about

oneOf.description: Type-dependent content of the journal entry
Type-dependent content of the journal entry

example.text: Please note schedule changes around midsummer!

set-credit-to.description: Force the time credit to this value. Used for positive balances.

set-debit-to.description: Force the time debit to this value. Used for negative balances.

tstamp.description: Timestamp for this change in milliseconds since the Unix Epoch

user-id.description: ID of the user who did the change

collection.description: Name of the collection that contains the changed document

company-id.description: Company ID that owns the changed document

other.description: All properties from the created, changed or deleted source document

original.description: All properties from the created, changed or deleted source document

document.description: All properties from the created, changed or deleted source document

properties.description: All properties from the created, changed or deleted source document

message.description: Message entered by the client when creating the order.

client-id.description:
Id of the company owning the request
Should almost always be set to the current user's company-id.

client.description: Name and contact defails of the client owning the request.

order-ref-id.description: Id referncing supplier- and client-orders. Only for internal use.

supplier-id.description:
Id of the company supplying the order.
When creating an order, the `supplier-id` is found in the order form associated with the order to be created.
For interal orders set `supplier-id` to the same value as `client-id`

supplier-company-id.description: Id representing a supplier's company-id, if set.

order-forms.description: List of order form ids which the client has access to view.

values.description: Client specific values which can be inherited into an order if specified in the order form.

supplier-code.description: The supplier code is used to invite new clients. The code can only be used once, and to be able the user as a client, the email is required to match the invited users email.

supplier-id.description:
Id of the company supplying the order form.
Should be used to set `order.supplier-id` when creating a new order.

shift-fields.description: List of shifts fields related to the order.

fields.description: List of additional custom fields related to the order.

field-template-id.description: Id of the registry field type used

id.description: Unique identifier representing a specific custom field

public.description: Allow the client to see this field.

protected.description: Field should only the editable by and visible for the supplier.

id.description: Unique identifier representing a specific Supplier. If supplier-company-id is set, that value is returned instead of the object id.

vid.description: Unique identifier representing a specific version of an item

company-id.description: Id of the company who owns this item.

archived.description: Timestamp in milliseconds for when the object was archived, or null if it is still active

client-company-id.description: Id representing a client's company-id, if set.

order-forms.description: List of order form ids which the client has access to view.

values.description: Supplier specific values which can be inherited into an order if specified in the order form.

client-code.description: The client code is used to invite new suppliers. The code can only be used once, and to be able the user as a supplier, the email is required to match the invited users email.

expires.description: Timestamp in milliseconds for when the rfq expires.

client.description: Name and contact defails of the client owning the request.

shift-ids.description: Array of connected shifts. (Intended for internal use.)

duplicity.description: Amount of people to be booked for the this rfq.

booked-duplicity.description: Amount of people currently confirmed on the rfq.

refusal-code-reason.description: Refusal code reason. Included for failed transactions. [Refusal code reason glossary](https://docs.adyen.com/development-resources/refusal-reasons).

schedule.description: Tag combination required for being scheduled. See User/combinations.

report.description: Tag combination required for creating independent time reports. See User/combinations.

value.description: Value can be anything, both primitive types and arrays and objects.

client-id.description: Id of the company owning the RfQ.

outgoing-rfq-id.description: Id of the rfq parent this rfq was created from.

rfq-shift-id.description: The corresponding shift-id from the RfQ.

booked-users.description: A list containing exactly one user id.

id-no.description: National identification number (personnummer) of the worker

supplier-id.description: Id of the company owning the quote shifts.

outgoing-rfq-id.description: Id of the rfq parent this rfq was created from.

read-only.description: Mark this registry as read-only, to prevent changes from the front-end

client-id.description: Id of the company owning the RfQ.

outgoing-rfq-id.description: Id of the rfq parent this rfq was created from.

supplier-id.description: Id of the company supplying the form.

shift-fields.description: List of shifts fields related to the form.

fields.description: List of additional custom fields related to the form.

terms.description: legal terms shown when confirming a quote.
terms.example: I hereby confirm that I understand the terms of this order and that it is binding.Any changes must be confirmed by both parties.

field-template-id.description: Id of the registry field type used

id.description: Unique identifier representing a specific custom field

public.description: Allow the client to see this field.

protected.description: Field should only the editable by and visible for the supplier.

duplicity.description: Maximum (and desired) number of booked users

accepted-quote-shifts.description: List of accepted quote shifts for this RfQ shift

confirmed-quote-shifts.description: List of confirmed quote shifts for this RfQ shift

shift-id.description: The corresponding shift-id from which this RfQshift was created.

outgoing-rfq-id.description: ID of order that created the shift

status.description:
Status of the rfq:
 * `active` - Part of a RFQ
 * `removed` - Shift got removed form RFQ

supplier-company-id.description: Id representing a client's company-id, if set.

rfq-forms.description: List of rfq form ids which the supplier has access to view.

values.description: Supplier specific values which can be inherited into an rfq if specified in the rfq form.

client-code.description: The client code is used to invite new suppliers. The code can only be used once, and to be able the user as a supplier, the email is required to match the invited users email.

duplicity.description: Maximum (and desired) number of booked users

withhold.description: Hide shift from users making it visible for managers only

order-id.description: ID of order that created the shift

group-id.description: Common group ID for grouping several shifts together

mirror-shift-id.description: The corresponding shift-id for the client or supplier when this shift is part of an order

not-booked-user-ids.description: User IDs that should not be booked on these shifts, use "*" to unbook everyone

booked-user-ids.description: User IDs that should be booked on these shift, sorted in the order they should be booked

conflict-policy.description: How to proceed if a user is already booked on an overlapping shift.

sender-shift-start.description: Start date of shift, collected from the object.

recipient-shift-id.description: Shift belonging to recipient, to be changed in.

sender-shift-end.description: End date of shift, collected from the object.

expires.description: Timestamp in milliseconds when the shift exchange expires

shift-selector.description: Shifts matching selector will be ensured to be published.
Shifts matching selector will be ensured to be unpublished.

price-user-day.description: Maximum daily cost per scheduled user

price-user-rfq.description: Price per booked user on a RFQ shift

discount-code.description: Discount code used when activating subscription

start.description: Start of time report without time zone (i.e. 2019-04-30T15:41:00.000)

end.description: End of time report without time zone (i.e. 2019-04-30T15:41:00.000)

shift-id.description: Reported against shift with this id.

user-id.description: ID of currently logged in user

role.description: Role of currently logged in user

created.description: Timestamp in milliseconds for when the token was created

expires.description: Timestamp in milliseconds for when the token will expire

audience.description: ID of intended audience for the token

target.description: Specify the target of this transaction. E.g. if the `type` is `invoice`, then the `target` should be set to the invoice of the id.

company-id.description: Id of the company this transactions is recorded for. If the request is made on behalf of a user, then the company id of the current session will be used.

username.description: Unique username used for logging in

bank-account.description: Users bank account for salary payments

lang.description: users preferred language (en,sv,da or nb currently supported)

int-mobile.description: users full mobile with country code applied

last-login.description: last login timestamp (milliseconds since unix epoch)

last-access.description: last access timestamp (milliseconds since unix epoch)

first-login.description: first login timestamp (milliseconds since unix epoch)

phone_number.description: Full user phone number with international prefix

updated_at.description: Timestamp in seconds for when the user was last changed

fulltime-hours.description: Hours in a fulltime work week.

start.description: Starting date and time of shift.

end.description: Ending date and time of shift.

start.description: Starting date and time of break.

end.description: Ending date and time of break.

criteriaParam.name: interval[match]
criteriaParam.description: Define how to match the interval
